results.meeting_purpose: Review and finalize the 2026 Yearly Plan for Consumer Mega-Alliance Q1, addressing draft feedback and aligning on strategic priorities

decisions.what: Create AOV-focused squad in Q2 with dedicated KPI, self-funded
decisions.context: Focus in Q1 is to roll out new personalized core journey including widgets, then layer in upselling components in Q2

decisions.what: Reserve 20% of engineering IC capacity for legacy loyalty program maintenance while evolving new loyalty framework
decisions.context: Implementing new vendor-based loyalty program launching first in US

decisions.what: Decouple forecasting from personalization models with independent technical interfaces
decisions.context: Enable independent iteration; assess organizational impact in Q1-Q2

decisions.what: Pause Programs on Factor funnel for peak due to negative results
decisions.context: Will partner with Commercial and New Programs hire in NA to design better Active Experience and 3rd-party partnerships in Q2

decisions.what: Defer variable pricing to Q3 in Market Innovation squad backlog
decisions.context: Urgently requested by markets but needs long-term ownership definition as pricing ownership moves to growth MA

decisions.what: Prioritize recipe bridge feature in Q4/Q1 for Project 5M
decisions.context: Addresses behavioral gap where users save recipes but rarely act on them, indicating high inspiration desire but execution friction

action_items.task: Share prioritization framework for Project 5M
Define technical interfaces for decoupling forecasting from personalization
action_items.timeline: Q1-Q2 validation and org impact assessment

action_items.task: Sign off on Factor requirements integration
Update FAQ 11 for RAF program alignment
Define long-term ownership for variable pricing before initiation
Roll out Elysium (new store and homepage in app)
action_items.timeline: Fast rollout followed by new app features

action_items.task: Prioritize P500 readiness and Penguin for Factor US
Expand Penguin personalization to INTL markets
action_items.timeline: Q1/Q2 for HF-UK, HF-CA, CP-CA, HF-ANZ, HF-BNL, HF-DKSE, HF-DEAT; H2 for other RTE markets

action_items.task: Design better Active Experience and 3rd-party partnerships for Factor
action_items.owner: Alison Ryan with Commercial and New Programs hire

action_items.task: Strengthen RAF program and build new in-product sharing loops

key_points: Menu expansion plans, personalization rollouts, and app features integration clarified with Elysium rollout and menu ranking models
Project 5M prioritization based on competitor analysis and internal workshop revealing recipe inspiration-to-execution gap
Reconciliation of marketing RAF plan with tech yearly plan to address growth target gaps
Factor tech requests collected and integrated into Market Innovation backlog
Loyalty strategy spans maintaining legacy program while launching new vendor-based program in US
Variable pricing identified as urgent market need but deferred to address ownership transition
blockers: Gap between Marketing and Consumer growth targets for RAF program
Negative results from Programs on Factor funnel requiring pause during peak
Need to define long-term ownership for variable pricing as pricing ownership transitions to growth MA
Dependency on expediting Penguin for INTL markets (fallback to Penguin Harp personalization if not possible)
follow_ups: Walk through detailed methodology for Project 5M prioritization if requested
Assess organizational impact of decoupled forecasting after Q1-Q2 validation
Review Factor backlog selections during quarterly planning
Alignment on pending topics/ordering mentioned in comments

results.doc_title: Connect on CA B2B Shopify Integration - 2025/12/15 11:29 EST - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: To scope the work required for implementing a B2B Shopify integration for the Canadian market and discuss timeline and resource allocation

decisions.what: Q3 2025 launch timeline for Shopify integration
decisions.context: Based on June start date for dedicated B2B team and estimated one month development time

decisions.what: Manual testing of B2B streams in first half of year
decisions.context: Will test sports teams, gyms, and private retail locations (universities) until Shopify integration is ready

decisions.what: Use Shopify as middleware solution
decisions.context: Current systems except Katana don't support required B2B functionality out of the box

decisions.what: Focus on small business employee orders (Factor only, not HelloFresh)
decisions.context: Current manual ordering system is error-prone and needs automation

action_items.task: Discuss business case with Kieran to adapt for Canada and determine integration timeline
Forward meeting notes to Kevin and Cole (Director of Growth)
Provide timeline update to Kevin (DM for Factor Canada)
Set realistic expectations with SLT about resource constraints

key_points: Canadian B2B site requires more work than initially expected
None of current systems except Katana support required B2B functionality out of the box
Shopify needed as middleware for consolidation
B2B success depends heavily on sales presence and field team, not just technology
Currently zero people allocated to B2B development within funding
Dedicated B2B team expected to be pushed for around June by Adam, Factor, and Ed
Development estimated to take about one month once team is allocated
Main purpose is to automate small business employee orders to reduce manual errors
Not planning to use for retail immediately - focusing on unlocking small businesses first
Integration requires extensive work with retailers/businesses for order placement and inventory management
Possible transition to HubSpot CRM mentioned

blockers.issue: Zero people currently allocated to B2B development
blockers.impact: Cannot start dedicated work until June when B2B team is formed

blockers.issue: Resource constraints - only Elysa and direct report on Canadian B2B initiative
blockers.impact: Limited capacity for both growth and revenue management

blockers.issue: No current systems support B2B functionality except Katana
blockers.impact: Requires Shopify middleware solution and extensive integration work

blockers.issue: Manual ordering system currently in place

follow_ups: Kevin and Cole to review notes and provide any questions
Business case discussion with Kieran
Potential formation of dedicated B2B team around June
JAMA submission once work begins

results.doc_title: HF CA B2B - 2025/12/17 16:46 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Discuss launching a Shopify B2B store in Canada to block out competition and plan implementation approach

decisions.what: Proceed with sales pilot regardless of technical implementation status
decisions.context: Ian confirmed they will run the sales pilot no matter what, but wants it to succeed with proper storefront support

decisions.what: Use minimal integration approach for pilot - storefront only with manual backend processes
decisions.context: For small volumes (450 meals/week breakeven), only need storefront and simple data output without SCM integrations

decisions.what: Lift and shift US B2B Shopify store setup using Anata for Canada
decisions.context: Most straightforward approach given resource constraints and existing US setup

decisions.what: Pivot sales model to annual subscriptions instead of weekly subscriptions
decisions.context: Sales team recommending annual sales with weekly meal selection or monthly menu distribution

action_items.task: Get back to Ian with feasibility assessment and plan
Introduce Ian to Nurev (agency chairman) and request pricing quote
Discuss with Ally and have her start investigating implementation details
Talk with Samir and get feedback
Allocate resources (Ian Brooks and Kevin) for sales handling

key_points: Competitor approached, creating urgency to launch Canadian store to block competition
Break-even point is 450 meals per week - considered achievable
Resource constraints due to GC Netherlands migration blocking implementation team until February
Storefront is easiest piece; fulfillment method is the key challenge
Existing contracts with US entity for Factor cover Shopify and Anata - Canadian business can likely piggyback
Anata manages storefront setup, CRM, design, and endpoint integration; internal team handles URLs, tracking, and internal integrations
PM could handle simple storefront with minimal engineering support using knowledge from VMS and Good Shop launches
Successfully negotiated 25-30% price reduction on Good Shop project by cutting corners
Sales model shift from weekly to annual subscriptions with weekly meal selection or monthly menus

blockers.issue: Implementation team blocked until February due to GC Netherlands migration
blockers.impact: Cannot start full implementation until after January 30th deadline
blockers.context: GC Netherlands migration must deliver all migrated customers to HelloFresh by the 30th

blockers.issue: Technical complexity of disabling US functionality
blockers.impact: Need to strip out Katana integrations and confirm fulfillment system compatibility
blockers.context: US and Canada DC setups and fulfillment systems need verification

blockers.issue: Contracts only exist with US entity
blockers.impact: Need to confirm Canadian business can piggyback on existing Shopify and Anata contracts
blockers.context: Current contracts are with US entity for Factor

follow_ups: Friday meeting to review feasibility and pricing
Confirm fulfillment systems and DC setup compatibility between US and Canada
Verify contract coverage for Canadian business entity
Determine if full integrations needed after pilot success and build business case
Finalize sales model approach (annual vs weekly subscriptions)

entities.context: Meeting participant, driving Canadian store launch, planning sales resources with Kevin for March

entities.context: Sales resource planned for March to handle Canadian sales alongside Ian

entities.context: Previous store launch providing knowledge base for Canadian implementation
